intro: Schismocarpus matudae, commonly known as the Matudae's schismocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into dry, capsule-like fruits. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
